response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agency must determine if records exist and will be disclosed within 10 days
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Records must be made 'promptly available' but no specific deadline specified
response_requirements.extension_conditions: Unusual circumstances: need to search separate facilities, voluminous records, consultation with other agencies, compiling electronic records, or cyberattack preventing access to electronic systems
response_requirements.cyberattack_provisions: NEW 2025 (AB 370): Cyberattack added as unusual circumstance. Agency must provide written notice explaining cyberattack impact and provide alternative formats if available.

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Search time not chargeable unless voluminous
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Direct costs of duplication only - actual cost varies by agency and format
fee_structure.computer_programming_fee: Actual cost when database extracts or programming required
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: No statutory fee waiver provision; fees limited to direct costs only

exemptions.description: Personnel, medical files where disclosure would constitute unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Home addresses and assessor parcel numbers of elected officials upon written request for confidentiality
exemptions.notes: NEW 2025: Enhanced privacy protection for current and former elected officials and family members

exemptions.description: Law enforcement investigatory records in specified circumstances
exemptions.coordination_note: AB 134 (2025) clarifies coordination with Penal Code § 832.7 peace officer misconduct records

exemptions.description: Preliminary drafts, notes, or interagency or intra-agency memoranda not retained by the public agency in the ordinary course of business
Records of communications privileged under attorney-client privilege
Trade secrets as defined in Civil Code § 3426.1
Records pertaining to pending litigation to which the public agency is a party
Investigation files compiled by law enforcement agencies where disclosure would endanger proceedings or safety

appeal_process.first_level: No administrative appeal - direct to court
appeal_process.first_level_notes: California CPRA does not provide administrative appeal process
appeal_process.second_level: Superior Court - Petition for Writ of Mandate
appeal_process.second_level_deadline_notes: No specific statutory deadline for filing petition
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court shall award reasonable attorney's fees and other litigation costs to substantially prevailing plaintiff
appeal_process.proposed_ombudsperson: AB 541 (pending 2025) proposes creation of California Public Records Act Ombudsperson for mediation - pending appropriation

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Agencies may not require explanation of why records are requested or intended use
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written or oral requests accepted; no specific form required
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must reasonably describe identifiable records

agency_obligations.response_format_options: Electronic format when requested and available; commonly used and machine-readable formats preferred
agency_obligations.accessibility_requirements: Must consider accessibility requirements for disabled requesters
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Statute must be construed liberally favoring disclosure
agency_obligations.cyberattack_documentation: Must document cyberattack impacts thoroughly and provide alternative access methods when possible (AB 370, 2025)

oversight_body.name: No designated oversight body (proposed California Public Records Act Ombudsperson pending)
oversight_body.role: AB 541 proposes ombudsperson for mediation services - pending appropriation

official_resources.statute_reorganization_note: Reorganized from sections 6250-6270 to section 7920 et seq. in 2023

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official California statute text and 2025 legislative amendments. Response times specified as calendar days (10-day initial response to determine if records exist and will be disclosed). 14-day extension allowed for unusual circumstances including NEW cyberattack provisions (AB 370, effective July 14, 2025). No administrative appeal - direct to Superior Court via Petition for Writ of Mandate. Enhanced privacy protections for elected officials (AB 1785, 2025). Clarified POST Commission procedures (AB 134, expires 2027).
key_2025_changes: Cyberattack added as unusual circumstance for extensions
Enhanced privacy for elected officials' home addresses
